org.scale7.portability
Class SystemProxy

java.lang.Object
  org.scale7.portability.SystemProxy

public class SystemProxy
extends Object

A system that proxies the creation of certain objects and execution of some actions. This was originally created because if writing a Red5 application, when you wish to acquire a logger for your specific application, as opposed to the logger belonging to the main server itself, it is necessary to make the following call Logger logger = Red5LoggerFactory.getLogger(clazz, "myApp");. This proxy makes it possible to have the wyki libraries log to the Red5 application, rather than the Red5 server.

Author:
dominicwilliams

Method Detail

getLoggerFromFactory

public static org.slf4j.Logger getLoggerFromFactory(Class clazz)
Get a SLF4J Logger object (SLF4J provides a proxy for all the main Java logging systems used such that you can switch your application between systems simply by dropping in a jar proxy file). If the SLF4J Logger needs to be created in a special way, for example inside some J2EE application environment, then you can change the default ILoggerFactory used to generate the logger using setLoggerFactory.

Parameters:
clazz - A reference to the class performing the logging
Returns:
The SLF4J Logger object

setLoggerFactory

public static void setLoggerFactory(ILoggerFactory loggerFactory)
